The International Finance Corporation (IFC), a member of the World Bank Group, has eight Performance Standards that define its environmental and social requirements for investment projects. These Performance Standards are:

Performance Standard 1: Assessment and Management of Environmental and Social Risks and Impacts
This standard requires clients to identify and assess the potential environmental and social risks and impacts of their projects and develop a management plan to avoid or mitigate negative impacts.

Performance Standard 2: Labor and Working Conditions
This standard sets out requirements for fair and safe working conditions, including freedom of association and collective bargaining, non-discrimination, and no child labor or forced labor.

Performance Standard 3: Resource Efficiency and Pollution Prevention
This standard aims to minimize the project's environmental footprint and maximize resource efficiency through the adoption of cleaner production processes, waste management, and pollution prevention measures.

Performance Standard 4: Community Health, Safety, and Security
This standard requires clients to ensure the safety and security of local communities and employees, including emergency preparedness and response measures.

Performance Standard 5: Land Acquisition and Involuntary Resettlement
This standard establishes requirements for the fair treatment of affected communities during the acquisition of land and resettlement of people, including adequate compensation and livelihood restoration.

Performance Standard 6: Biodiversity Conservation and Sustainable Management of Living Natural Resources
This standard aims to ensure the conservation of natural habitats and biodiversity, as well as the sustainable management of living natural resources, including fisheries and forests.

Performance Standard 7: Indigenous Peoples
This standard recognizes the rights of indigenous peoples and requires clients to engage with them in a culturally appropriate manner and obtain their free, prior, and informed consent for any project activities that may affect them.
